00037 #define PS2_CLK_LOW             PORTE &= ~(1<<6)
00039 #define PS2_CLK_HIGH    PORTE |= (1<<6)
00041 #define PS2_DATA_LOW    PORTA &= ~(1<<3)
00043 #define PS2_DATA_HIGH   PORTA |= (1<<3)

00049 unsigned int driver_output_state = 0;
00051 unsigned int driver_output_type[12];

00067 void __inline__ tiny_delay(void) {
00068         for (volatile unsigned char i=0;i<50;i++)
00069                 for (volatile unsigned char j=0;j<255;j++)
00070                         __asm__ __volatile__("nop");
00071 }
00072 
00079 void activate_output(unsigned char index, unsigned char type) {
00080         driver_output_state |= (1<<(index-1));
00081         driver_output_type[index-1] = type;
00082         
00083         switch (index) {
00084                 case 1 :        PORTC |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_1);
00085                                                         break;
00086                 case 2 :        PORTC |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_2);
00087                                                         break;
00088                 case 3 :        PORTC |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_3);
00089                                                         break;
00090                 case 4 :        PORTC |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_4);
00091                                                         break;
00092                 case 5 :        PORTC |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_5);
00093                                                         break;
00094                 case 6 :        PORTC |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_6);
00095                                                         break;
00096                 case 7 :        PORTC |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_7);
00097                                                         break;
00098                 case 8 :        PORTC |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_8);
00099                                                         break;
00100                 case 9 :        PORTA |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_9);
00101                                                         break;
00102                 case 10 :       PORTA |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_10);
00103                                                         break;
00104                 case 11 :       PORTA |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_11);
00105                                                         break;
00106                 case 12 :       PORTA |= (1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_12);
00107                                                         break;
00108                 default: 
00109                                                         break;
00110         }
00111 }
00112 
00118 void deactivate_output(unsigned char index) {
00119         driver_output_state &= ~(1<<(index-1));
00120         driver_output_type[index-1] = 0;
00121         
00122         switch (index) {
00123                 case 1 :        PORTC &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_1);
00124                                                         break;
00125                 case 2 :        PORTC &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_2);
00126                                                         break;
00127                 case 3 :        PORTC &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_3);
00128                                                         break;
00129                 case 4 :        PORTC &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_4);
00130                                                         break;
00131                 case 5 :        PORTC &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_5);
00132                                                         break;
00133                 case 6 :        PORTC &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_6);
00134                                                         break;
00135                 case 7 :        PORTC &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_7);
00136                                                         break;
00137                 case 8 :        PORTC &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_8);
00138                                                         break;
00139                 case 9 :        PORTA &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_9);
00140                                                         break;
00141                 case 10 :       PORTA &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_10);
00142                                                         break;
00143                 case 11 :       PORTA &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_11);
00144                                                         break;
00145                 case 12 :       PORTA &= ~(1<<DRIVER_OUTPUT_12);
00146                                                         break;
00147                 default: 
00148                                                         break;
00149         }
00150 }

00154 void parse_internal_comm_message(UC_MESSAGE message) {
00155         char temp=0;
00156 
00157         printf("CMD: 0x%02X\n",message.cmd);
00158         printf("LEN: %i\n",message.length);
00159         
00160         for (unsigned char i=0;i<message.length;i++)
00161                 printf("DATA[%i]: 0x%02X\n",i,message.data[i]);
00162         
00163         switch(message.cmd) {
00164                 case INT_COMM_REDIRECT_DATA:
00165                         computer_interface_send(message.data[0], message.data[1], (void *)message.data[2]);
00166                         break;
00167                 case BUS_CMD_DRIVER_ACTIVATE_ANT_OUTPUT :
00168                         for (unsigned char i=0;i<message.length;i++)
00169                                 activate_output(message.data[i], BUS_CMD_DRIVER_ACTIVATE_ANT_OUTPUT);
00170                         break;
00171                 case BUS_CMD_DRIVER_DEACTIVATE_ANT_OUTPUT:
00172                         for (unsigned char i=0;i<message.length;i++)
00173                                 deactivate_output(message.data[i]);
00174                         break;
00175                 case BUS_CMD_DRIVER_ACTIVATE_BAND_OUTPUT: 
00176                         for (unsigned char i=0;i<message.length;i++)
00177                                 activate_output(message .data[i], BUS_CMD_DRIVER_ACTIVATE_BAND_OUTPUT);
00178                         break;
00179                 case BUS_CMD_DRIVER_ACTIVATE_RX_ANT_OUTPUT:
00180                         for (unsigned char i=0;i<message.length;i++)
00181                                 activate_output(message.data[i], BUS_CMD_DRIVER_ACTIVATE_RX_ANT_OUTPUT);
00182                         break;
00183                 case BUS_CMD_DRIVER_DEACTIVATE_ALL_OUTPUTS:
00184                         for (unsigned char i=1;i<=12;i++)
00185                                 deactivate_output(i);
00186                         break;
00187                 case BUS_CMD_DRIVER_DEACTIVATE_ALL_ANT_OUTPUTS:
00188                         for (unsigned char i=1;i<=12;i++)
00189                                 if (driver_output_type[i-1] == BUS_CMD_DRIVER_ACTIVATE_ANT_OUTPUT)
00190                                         deactivate_output(i);
00191                         break;
00192                 case BUS_CMD_DRIVER_DEACTIVATE_RX_ANT_OUTPUT:
00193                         for (unsigned char i=1;i<=12;i++)
00194                                 if (driver_output_type[i-1] == BUS_CMD_DRIVER_ACTIVATE_RX_ANT_OUTPUT)
00195                                         deactivate_output(i);
00196                         break;
00197                 case BUS_CMD_DRIVER_DEACTIVATE_ALL_BAND_OUTPUTS:
00198                         for (unsigned char i=1;i<=12;i++)
00199                                 if (driver_output_type[i-1] == BUS_CMD_DRIVER_ACTIVATE_BAND_OUTPUT)
00200                                         deactivate_output(i);
00201                         break;          
00202                 case INT_COMM_AUX_CHANGE_OUTPUT_PIN:
00203                         switch(message.data[0]) {
00204                                 case AUX_X11_PIN3: 
00205                                         if (message.data[1] == 1)
00206                                                 PORTA |= (1<<0);
00207                                         else
00208                                                 PORTA &= ~(1<<0);
00209                                         
00210                                         break;
00211                                 case AUX_X11_PIN8: 
00212                                         if (message.data[1] == 1)
00213                                                 PORTA |= (1<<1);
00214                                         else
00215                                                 PORTA &= ~(1<<1);
00216                                         
00217                                         break;
00218                                 case AUX_X11_PIN4:
00219                                         if (message.data[1] == 1)
00220                                                 PORTA |= (1<<2);
00221                                         else
00222                                                 PORTA &= ~(1<<2);
00223                                         
00224                                         break;
00225                                 case AUX_X11_PIN5:
00226                                         if (message.data[1] == 1)
00227                                                 PORTF |= (1<<5);
00228                                         else
00229                                                 PORTF &= ~(1<<5);
00230                                         
00231                                         break;
00232                                 case AUX_X11_PIN9:
00233                                         if (message.data[1] == 1)
00234                                                 PORTF |= (1<<4);
00235                                         else
00236                                                 PORTF &= ~(1<<4);
00237                                         break;
00238                         }
00239                         
00240                         break;
00241                 case INT_COMM_GET_BAND_BCD_STATUS:
00242                         //Read the status of the BCD input on the top floor and return it
00243                         /* PF0 - Input  - BCD input Bit 2
00244                          * PF1 - Input  - BCD input Bit 3
00245                          * PF2 - Input  - BCD input Bit 0
00246                          * PF3 - Input  - BCD input Bit 1 */
00247                         
00248                         temp = (PINF & (1<<2)) >> 2;
00249                         temp |= (PINF & (1<<3)) >> 2;
00250                         temp |= (PINF & (1<<0)) << 2;
00251                         temp |= (PINF & (1<<1)) << 2;
00252                         
00253                         /*if (band_change_count < 10000) {
00254                                 temp = 0x03;
00255                         }
00256                         else if ((band_change_count > 10000) && (band_change_count < 20000)) {
00257                                 temp = 0x05;
00258                         }
00259                         else {
00260                                 temp = 0x02;
00261                                 band_change_count = 0;
00262                         }*/
00263                         
00264                         internal_comm_add_tx_message(INT_COMM_GET_BAND_BCD_STATUS, 1, &temp);
00265                         break;
00266                 case INT_COMM_PULL_THE_PLUG:
00267                         printf("PULLING THE PLUG\n");
00268                         //Will drop the voltage to the input relay
00269                         //
00270                         PORTB &= ~(1<<7);
00271                         break;
00272                 default:
00273                         break;
00274         }
00275 }
00276 
00279 void ps2_keyboard_send(unsigned char cmd) {
00280         ps2.transmit = 1;
00281         ps2.bit_count = 0;
00282         ps2.tx_data = cmd;
00283         ps2.parity = ~parity_even_bit(cmd);
00284                 
00285         DDRA |= (1<<3);
00286         PS2_DATA_HIGH;
00287         DDRE |= (1<<6);
00288         PS2_CLK_LOW;
00289         tiny_delay();
00290         tiny_delay();
00291         tiny_delay();
00292         PS2_DATA_LOW;
00293         tiny_delay();
00294         DDRE &= ~(1<<6);
00295         PS2_CLK_HIGH;
00296         ps2.bit_count = 0;
00297 }
00298 
00301 void ps2_process_key(unsigned char key_code) {
00302         internal_comm_add_tx_message(INT_COMM_PS2_KEYPRESSED,1,&key_code);
00303 }
00304 
00306 int main(void) {
00307         delay_ms(100);
00308         //Pull the input voltage relay
00309         DDRB |= (1<<7);
00310         PORTB |= (1<<7);
00311 
00312         cli();
00313         
00314         //Initialize internal communication
00315         internal_comm_init((void*)parse_internal_comm_message,(void*)usart0_transmit);
00316         
00317         computer_interface_init();
00318         
00319         init_ports();
00320         init_timer_0();
00321         
00322         //19.2kbaud
00323         usart1_init(47);
00324         fdevopen((void*)usart1_transmit, (void*)usart1_receive_loopback);
00325         
00326         //19.2kbaud - internal comm
00327         usart0_init(47);
00328         
00329         printf("Motherboard started\n");
00330         
00331         sei();
00332 
00333         //Init the values in the ps2 struct
00334         ps2.started = 0;
00335         ps2.bit_count = 0;
00336         ps2.data = 0;
00337         ps2.data_ready = 0;
00338         
00339         delay_ms(200);
00340         
00341         PORTA |= (1<<3);
00342         
00343         //ps2_keyboard_send(0xF4);
00344         delay_ms(100);
00345         
00346         while(1) {
00347                 //computer_interface_send_data();
00348                 //computer_interface_parse_data();
00349                 
00350                 //Poll the RX queue in the internal comm to see if we have any new messages to be PARSED
00351                 internal_comm_poll_rx_queue();
00352                 
00353                 //Poll the TX queue in the internal comm to see if we have any new messages to be SENT
00354                 internal_comm_poll_tx_queue();
00355                 
00356                 //Check if ON/OFF button was pressed, if so we send a message to the front panel
00357                 //which in it's turn will send a message to turn the device off after all settings have been saved
00358                 //and messages have been sent out to all slave cards
00359                 if ((btn_on_off_last_state == 0) && (PINB & (1<<6))) {
00360                         while ((PINB & (1<<6)));
00361                         delay_s(1);
00362                         internal_comm_add_tx_message(INT_COMM_TURN_DEVICE_OFF,0,0);
00363                         btn_on_off_last_state = 1;
00364                 }
00365         }
00366 }
00367 
00369 ISR(SIG_OUTPUT_COMPARE0) {
00370         counter_time_start++;
00371         
00372         if (counter_time_start > 5000) {
00373                 btn_on_off_last_state = 0;
00374         }
00375         
00376         /*if (counter_ps2 > 250) {
00377                 ps2.started = 0;
00378                 ps2.bit_count = 0;
00379                 ps2.data = 0;
00380                 
00381                 counter_ps2 = 0;
00382         }
00383         
00384         counter_ps2++;
00385         */
00386         internal_comm_1ms_timer();
00387         
00388         band_change_count++;
00389 }

00392 ISR(SIG_OVERFLOW0) {
00393         
00394 }
